content.description: View the questions before you start the survey (external link)
list: This survey provides real-time information during the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic to help inform the UK response.
Your response helps ensure your business, and businesses like yours, are represented.

content.description: Thank you for completing this survey at this challenging time.

list: Information should relate to the UK.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.
This survey is refreshed every two weeks.
To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.

content.description: This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information about:

list: how the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic may have affected the business's turnover in the last two weeks
profits
footfall

content.description: This section asks for information about the business's exporting and importing activities.

questions.question: Prices of materials, goods and services

content.description: This section asks for information on any changes to the prices of goods and services bought or sold by the business in the last two weeks.
This section asks for information about how the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic may have affected the business's stock.
This section asks for information about:

list: any UK or devolved administration's government schemes or initiatives that the business has applied, or intends to apply, for
applications for non-government financial support
cash reserves
confidence in business survival

content.description: This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

list: percentage on furlough leave or working from home
percentage returning from furlough or homeworking
percentage of furloughed staff receiving top-ups in addition to the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS) payments
impact of homeworking and productivity

content.description: It also asks about future site closures.
This section asks for information about the characteristics of your workforce.
We are asking these questions to help understand how workforce characteristics may have changed across different sectors

blocks.title: Trading status of your business
blocks.description: This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s trading status?
questions.description: Only select "paused trading" if all trading activity has temporarily stopped for the business named on this survey.

options.label: Currently trading and have been for more than the last two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

blocks.title: Turnover, profits and footfall
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about how the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic may have affected:

  • turnover in the last two weeks and expectations for the next two weeks
  • profits in the last two weeks
  • footfall

questions.title: In the last two weeks, how has the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic affected {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s turnover, compared with normal expectations for this time of year?

content.description: Exclude:

list: change expected due to seasonal effects
change expected due to normal patterns of business activity

options.label: Turnover has increased by more than 50%
options.value: Turnover has increased by more than 50%

options.label: Turnover has increased by up to 20%
options.value: Turnover has increased by up to 20%

options.label: Turnover has decreased by up to 20%
options.value: Turnover has decreased by up to 20%

options.label: Turnover has decreased by more than 50%
options.value: Turnover has decreased by more than 50%

questions.title: Please explain in more detail how the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic affected turnover in the last two weeks
What are your expectations about turnover for the next two weeks?

options.label: Expect turnover to increase a little
options.value: Expect turnover to increase a little

options.label: Expect turnover to stay the same
options.value: Expect turnover to stay the same

options.label: Expect turnover to decrease a little
options.value: Expect turnover to decrease a little

questions.title: In the last two weeks, how has the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic affected your business's profits, compared with normal expectations for this time of year?

options.label: Profits have increased by more than 50%
options.value: Profits have increased by more than 50%

options.label: Profits have increased by between 20% and 50%
options.value: Profits have increased by between 20% and 50%

options.label: Profits have increased by up to 20%
options.value: Profits have increased by up to 20%

options.label: Profits have decreased by up to 20%
options.value: Profits have decreased by up to 20%

options.label: Profits have decreased by between 20% and 50%
options.value: Profits have decreased by between 20% and 50%

options.label: Profits have decreased by more than 50%
options.value: Profits have decreased by more than 50%

content.description: "Footfall" means the number of people entering a shop or shopping area.

blocks.title: Access to financial support
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • any UK or devolved administration's government schemes or initiatives that the business has applied, or intends to apply, for
  • applications for non-government financial support
  • cash reserves
  • confidence in business survival

questions.title: Has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} applied for any of the following schemes?

options.label: Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme
options.description: UK Government scheme that covers 80% of  furloughed workers' pay, by a combination of government and employer contributions

options.label: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements
options.value: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements
options.description: For example, COVID Corporate Financing Facility (CCFF), Coronavirus Business Interruption Loan Scheme (CBILS or CLBILS), Bounce Back Loan Scheme (BBLS) or loans from devolved governments

options.label: Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments
options.value: Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments
options.description: Including small business grant funds and sector-specific grants  (for example in the arts, hospitality or retail sectors) in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland

options.label: Not applied for any of these schemes
options.value: Not applied for any of these schemes

values: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements
Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments

questions.title: Has your business applied for the Development Bank of Wales COVID-19 Business Loan Scheme?

values: Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments

values: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements

content.description: Exclude any schemes that your business has already applied for

options.label: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements
options.value: Government-backed accredited loans or finance agreements
options.description: For example, COVID Corporate Financing Facility (CCFF), Coronavirus Business Interruption Loan Scheme (CBILS or CLBILS), Bounce Back Loan Scheme (BBLS) or loans from devolved governments

options.value: Business grants funded by the UK and devolved governments
options.description: Include small business grant funds and sector-specific grants in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland

options.label: Job Retention Bonus
options.description: A 1000 payment to employers for each eligible employee brought back to work from furlough, if continuously employed up to the end of January 2021

options.label: Kickstart Job Scheme for young people
options.value: Kickstart Job Scheme for young people
options.description: Government  subsidy for six-month work placements for people on Universal Credit aged between 16 and 24

options.label: Not intending to apply for any of these schemes
options.value: Not intending to apply for any of these schemes

questions.title: Why is your business not intending to apply for the Job Retention Bonus?

definitions.title: What we mean by "Job Retention Bonus"

content.description: This is a £1000 payment to employers for each eligible employee brought back to work from furlough, if continuously employed up to the end of January 2021.

options.label: Furloughed employees will be made redundant before the end of January 2021
options.value: Furloughed employees will be made redundant before the end of January 2021

options.label: Furloughed employees are not eligible
options.description: To check eligibility, go to the GOV.UK website

options.label: We have not furloughed any employees
options.value: We have not furloughed any employees

questions.title: If any of your premises are required to close due to lockdown regulations, do you intend to apply for the "Job Support Scheme (JSS) Expansion for Closed Business Premises"?

content.description: Exclude the UK Government Job Support Scheme (JSS) for employees who will be working at least a third of their hours in viable jobs, and where the employer and government make a combined contribution

definitions.title: What we mean by the "Job Support Scheme (JSS) Expansion for Closed Business Premises"

content.description: This is the recently announced UK Government scheme which will contribute two-thirds of an employee's wage (up to a cap), for those who cannot work due to premises having to close as a result of lockdown regulations. For further information, go to the GOV.UK website.

options.label: Do not intend to use it
options.value: Do not intend to use it

values: Do not intend to use it

questions.title: How helpful do you expect the "Job Support Scheme (JSS) Expansion for Closed Business Premises" will be in preventing redundancies at your business in the next three months?

content.description: Exclude the UK Government Job Support Scheme (JSS) for employees who will be working at least a third of their hours in viable jobs, and where the employer and government make a combined contribution

blocks.title: Operational performance
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

  • percentage, for example, on furlough leave or working from home
  • percentage returning from furlough or homeworking
  • percentage of furloughed staff receiving top-ups in addition to the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS) payments
  • impact of homeworking, and productivity

It also asks about future site closures.

questions.title: In the last two weeks, approximately what percentage of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s workforce were:
questions.description: Your answers should add up to 100%. If your workforce did not fall into one of the categories, enter "0".

answers.label: On partial or full furlough leave
answers.description: Under the terms of the UK Government's Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS)

answers.label: Working at their normal place of work
answers.description: Include those who were normally homeworkers before the pandemic

answers.label: Working from home instead of at their normal place of work
answers.description: Exclude those who were normally homeworkers before the pandemic

answers.label: On sick leave or not working due to coronavirus (COVID-19)  symptoms, self-isolation or quarantine

values: Currently trading and have been for more than the last two weeks
Started trading within the last two weeks after a pause in trading
Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: Of those partially and fully furloughed, what percentage are fully furloughed?
questions.description: "Fully furloughed" refers to workers who are not working any of their normal hours and who you are claiming for under the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS).

content.description: Exclude furloughed staff who are working some hours. These staff are considered "partially furloughed"

definitions.title: How you might answer this question

content.description: If your answer to the previous question was that 80% of your workforce were on partial or full furlough leave, and all of these are on full furlough, then the answer would be 100%. If half of the 80% were on full furlough leave, and the other half partially furloughed, then the answer would be 50%.

answers.label: Approximate percentage of furloughed staff who are "fully furloughed"
Or select "Not sure"if the percentage is not known or is too difficult to calculate

questions.title: Is your business providing top-ups to any furloughed workers' pay, above the combined employer and Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS) 80% contribution?

content.description: Include:

list: top-ups paid by the employer to bring partially of fully furloughed workers pay over the 80% threshold

content.description: Exclude:

list: employer’s contribution for pay, National Insurance or pension payments, that are required under the CJRS terms and conditions

options.label: Yes, the business is providing a top-up
options.value: Yes, the business is providing a top-up

options.label: No, the business is not providing a top-up
options.value: No, the business is not providing a top-up

values: Yes, the business is providing a top-up
No, the business is not providing a top-up
Currently trading and have been for more than the last two weeks
Started trading within the last two weeks after a pause in trading
No, the business is not providing a top-up
Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: Of those on furlough leave, approximately what percentage of workers have had their pay topped up, above the combined employer and Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS) 80% contribution?

content.description: Include:

list: employees furloughed for either all, or some, of their normal working hours
employees the business is claiming for via the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS)

definitions.title: How you might answer this question

content.description: If 50% of your workforce have been furloughed, but you are topping up the pay for all of those furloughed workers, the answer would be 100%. If you are topping up the pay for half of those furloughed workers, the answer would be 50%.

answers.label: Percentage of furloughed workers with top-up pay

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: In the last two weeks, approximately what percentage of your workforce have:

answers.label: Returned from furlough to homeworking, either fully or partially
Returned from furlough to the normal workplace, either fully or partially
Moved from homeworking  to the normal workplace
answers.description: Exclude those who normally worked from home before the pandemic

answers.label: Moved from the normal workplace to homeworking

questions.title: In the next two weeks, approximately what percentage of your workforce will:

answers.label: Return from furlough to homeworking, either fully or partially
Return from furlough to the normal workplace, either fully or partially
Return to the workplace from homeworking
answers.description: Exclude those who normally worked from home before the pandemic

questions.title: Has your business had more staff working from home as a result of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic?
How has the increase in homeworking affected the productivity of your workforce?
Does your business intend to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?
Why do you intend to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool

options.label: Ability to better match jobs to skills
options.value: Ability to better match jobs to skills

questions.title: Why do you not intend to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Reduced reliability and retention of staff
options.value: Reduced reliability and retention of staff

values: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool
Ability to better match jobs to skills

questions.title: Is your business intending to permanently close any business sites in the next three months?
Where in the UK are the sites that will permanently close in the next three months?
How do you expect closing these sites to affect your workforce?
Approximately what percentage of your workforce do you expect to be made redundant over the next three months?

answers.label: Approximate percentage of redundancies in the next three months
Or select "Not sure"if the percentage is not known or is too difficult to calculate

questions.title: When do you expect these redundancies to happen?

blocks.title: Workforce characteristics
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about the characteristics of your workforce.

We are asking these questions to help understand how workforce characteristics may have changed across different sectors.

questions.title: Since the start of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, how has the number of workers from within the European Union (EU) at your business changed?

content.description: Exclude those from  the UK (England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland)

options.label: Number of workers from within the EU has increased
options.value: Number of workers from within the EU has increased

options.label: Number of workers from within the EU has stayed the same
options.value: Number of workers from within the EU has stayed the same

options.label: Number of workers from within the EU has decreased
options.value: Number of workers from within the EU has decreased
